Constructor Detail

FileOutput

public FileOutput(java.lang.String fileName)
Opens the given file for writing. If the file already exists, then any contents will be destroyed. If the file does not exist, it will be created with the given name.

FileOutput

public FileOutput(java.lang.String fileName,
                  java.lang.String mode)
If mode = "append" then this constructor opens the given file so that calls to print methods will append information to any existing information in the file. If the file does not exist, it will be created with the given name. If mode = "write" then this constructor opens the given file for writing, as in the one-parameter constgructor.
Method Detail

close

public void close()
Close the input file. Any attempt to write to this object after this function has been called will result in an error.
